author: mickpletcher
body:
## Integrate cleanmgr.exe with PowerShell

It would benefit Configuration Manager administrators greatly if there were PowerShell cmdlets for implementing cleanmgr.exe. This would greatly benefit us greatly by being able to remotely clean systems up for deployments using the PowerShell WinRM. 

## Proposed technical implementation details (optional)

I envision being able to use a cmdlet possibly labeled Invoke-DiskCleanup that would have parameters to meet the same selection as is shown when running cleanmgr.exe. The list would be
* Drive
* Computer
* lowdisk
* verylowdisk
* sageset
* sagerun
* Downloaded Program Files
* Temporary Internet Files
* Offline webpages
* Windows error reports and feedback
* DirectX Shader Cache
* Delivery Optimization Files
* Downloads
* Recycle Bin
* Temporary Files
* Thumbnails
* Remove Previous Windows Versions

Example: Invoke-DiskCleanup -drive c: -Downloads -RecycleBin -Thumbnails -Computer TestSystem

comments.author: vexx32
comments.body:
This kind of command would probably have to come from the Windows team, I'd imagine, since there would almost certainly have to be some fairly low-level APIs in play here for some of these things.

Hmm... oh, don't we already have some recycle bin cmdlets in one of the Windows modules?

comments.author: msftbot[bot]
comments.body: This issue has been marked as external and has not had any activity for **1 day**. It has been be closed for housekeeping purposes.

title: Feature Request
